events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application seeking funds to cover upcoming medical expenses and reduce accumulated credit card debt.
The application was categorised under Personal Loan based on the stated purpose related to medical bills and debt consolidation.
A loan officer was assigned to assist the applicant throughout the personal loan process and to provide guidance on required documentation.
The initial review of the applicant’s file was conducted to verify completeness and eligibility for the personal loan requested.
Additional documents were requested including recent medical bills, proof of income, and credit statements to assess loan suitability.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, ensuring the review process could continue without delay.
A credit check was performed revealing an average credit score and manageable existing debts relevant to the personal loan risk profile.
Risk assessment concluded that the applicant’s financial situation and credit history present a moderate risk for the personal loan.
A loan offer was presented outlining terms, interest rates, and repayment schedule tailored to the applicant’s debt consolidation and medical needs.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer and requested minor adjustments to the repayment period.
The application was escalated to a senior loan manager to review and approve the requested repayment period adjustment.
The personal loan was approved with the applicant’s requested repayment terms, reflecting flexibility towards their financial situation.
The loan amount was successfully disbursed into the applicant’s bank account, enabling immediate payment of medical debts.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant understood the repayment schedule and to offer support if needed.
The application process was formally closed following successful funding and applicant confirmation of satisfaction with the loan terms.
